name: Carlitzâ€“Wan conjecture
rephrased: A polynomial cannot be a permutation polynomial (which rearranges the elements of a finite field) of degree d over a finite field with q elements if the greatest common divisor of d and q-1 is greater than 1.
implication_form: If a polynomial has degree d over a finite field with q elements and the greatest common divisor of d and q-1 is greater than 1, then it cannot be a permutation polynomial.
